newsitem.title: GERMANY: German court continues Kolbenschmidt study.
newsitem.headline: German court continues Kolbenschmidt study.

text.p: The German Court of Appeals will continue studying the plans of British T&N Plc to take a strategic stake in German component maker Kolbenschmidt, a Federal Cartel Office spokeswoman said on Wednesday.
She said the court extended the study up until April 15.

British auto components engineer T&N has an option on a 24.99 percent stake in Kolbenschmidt. It considers the stake as a springboard to more control of Kolbenschmidt, but the cartel office has repeatedly blocked those ambitions.
The Court of Appeals is the body which decides on appeals against decisions made by the Federal Cartel Office.

The spokeswoman said that even following Wednesday's announcement by German engineering group Rheinmetall AG that it was acquiring a separate 24.99 percent stake in Kolbenschmidt, the cartel office was still opposed to T&N taking up its options.
She said the office thought T&N would still seek to gain overall control in Kolbenschmidt, which in turn would give it a dominant German market position in auto parts.
